## Local Development Setup with pnpm ```sh pnpm install pnpm run dev ``` ## Flexibility and dnd-kit Integration in dnd-timeline ```markdown

Flexible 🤺

very slim and flexible by design. dnd-timeline exposes utility functions and positional styling, and you can use them in conjunction with your favorite libraries.

Based on dnd-kit

All features exposed by the dnd-kit library are applicable to dnd-timeline. ``` ## Run Specific Example with Turborepo Filter ```sh pnpm run dev --filter home... ``` ## Install dnd-timeline Library ```sh npm install react npm install dnd-timeline ``` ## Headless UI and Hook-based Design in dnd-timeline ```markdown

Headless 🧠

dnd-timeline is a headless-ui library, and contains 0 styling, aside from functional styling (position, z-index, etc.).

Hook-based 🪝

Exposes simple hooks like useItem and useRow, that should integrate seamlessly into your existing architecture. ``` ## Local Development Setup ```sh npm install npm run dev ``` ## Handling Drag End Event with Relevance Update ```tsx const onDragEnd = (event: DragEndEvent) => { const overedId = event.over?.id.toString() if (!overedId) return const activeItemId = event.active.id const updatedRelevance = event.active.data.current.getRelevanceFromDragEvent?.(event) // update your state using the updated relevance. } ``` ## Performance, RTL, and Touch Support in dnd-timeline ```markdown

Performant 🏎️

Renders only when needed. All the intermediate states and animations are done using css transformations, and require 0 re-renders.

Supports RTL 🌍

Natively supports RTL. simply declare one of the parent divs as RTL with dir="rtl", and thats it.

Touch Support👆

Works with touch by default. Sensors can be highly configured using @dnd-kit's sensors. ``` ## Timeline Options ```APIDOC ## Timeline Configuration Options ### `range` #### Description Defines the currently viewable range of the timeline. This property is fully controlled, meaning its state must be managed externally. #### Type `Range` #### Range Type Definition ```typescript type Range = { start: number end: number } ``` ### `overlayed?` #### Description Determines whether items should be rendered during drag operations. Set to `true` when using `dnd-kit`'s `DragOverlay`. #### Type `boolean` #### Default Value `false` ### `rangeGridSizeDefinition?` #### Description Configures and enables snapping functionality within the timeline. It dictates the grid size to which elements snap during interactions. #### Type `number | GridSizeDefinition[]` #### `GridSizeDefinition` Type ```typescript type GridSizeDefinition = { value: number maxRangeSize?: number } ``` **Behavior:** - If a `number` is provided, it serves as the fixed snap grid size. - If an array of `GridSizeDefinition` is provided, the snap grid size is determined by the `value` of the member with the smallest `maxRangeSize` that matches the current range size. **Example for dynamic snap grid:** ```typescript const rangeGridSize: GridSizeDefinition[] = [ { value: hoursToMilliseconds(1), }, { value: minutesToMilliseconds(30), maxRangeSize: hoursToMilliseconds(24), } ] // This configuration snaps to 30 minutes if the range is less than 24 hours, otherwise snaps to 1 hour. ``` ### `usePanStrategy?` #### Description Enables and customizes the panning and zooming behavior of the timeline. The default strategy utilizes `ctrl + wheel` for zooming and `shift + ctrl + wheel` for panning. #### Type `UsePanStrategy` #### `UsePanStrategy` Type Definition ```typescript type UsePanStrategy = ( timelineRef: React.MutableRefObject, onPanEnd: OnPanEnd ) => void type OnPanEnd = (event: PanEndEvent) => void type PanEndEvent = { clientX?: number clientY?: number deltaX: number deltaY: number } ``` **Reference:** [zoom-and-pan](../zoom-and-pan/) ### `resizeHandleWidth?` #### Description Sets the width of the resize handle in pixels, affecting the sensitivity of the resize action. This can be overridden on a per-item basis using the same prop on `useItem`. #### Type `number` #### Default Value `20` #### Note Setting this to `0` disables resizing. ``` ## Install pnpm Package Manager ```sh corepack enable pnpm ```
